MDF.py¶

Overview¶

The main file in the mdfwriter package. Using the MDF class, a programmer can create an MDF object and add the necessary “ChannelGroup” objects that contain “Channel” objects to the MDF object. An MDF object can also absorb/import a DEJ containing information about the CAN data that will be logged to the file.

class mdf.ChannelGroup(name, description='')[source]¶

Class for non-CAN record groups to be added to MDF. :param name: The name of the Channel Group.

addChannel(channel)[source]¶

Method for adding Channel object to ChannelGroup object. All Channel Objects must be added to the ChannelGroup before the ChannelGroup is added to the MDF.

getCG()[source]¶

Used to get referenced CG object within the MDF file.

getSignalList()[source]¶

Used to get the list of channels within a channel group.

class mdf.Channel(name, units, description='')[source]¶

Base class Channel. :param: name: Name of Channel :param: units: Units of Channel :param: description: Text description of Channel. Max 128 characters.

class mdf.CANmsg(messageName)[source]¶

Class for CAN messages to be added to MDF. Extends :class: ChannelGroup, and adds necessary properties for proper CAN data parsing in CANape. :param messageName: Name of CAN message

addSignal(signal)[source]¶

Used to add a Signal object to the CANmsg object. Note: Can not pass parent of Signal object ‘Channel’.

getCGBlock()[source]¶

Used to get the CG object in the MDF file for reference when writing.

getSignalList()[source]¶

Used to get the list of signals within a CAN message.

class mdf.CANSignal(name, description='')[source]¶

Child class of Channel with additional properties to make it compatabile with a CAN signal with a CAN mesasge.

class mdf.DEJ(dej_path)[source]¶

DEJ Class used to parse DEJ JSON file and store information as CANmsg objects with their respective CAN Signal objects. :param dej_path: Path to .json DEJ file

class mdf.MDF(filename, author, project, dut, filedescription='TextBlock')[source]¶

Main class of package. MDF object that holds all necessary information to write file correctly. :param filename: Name of file to be created (.mdf automatically appended) :param author: Creator of file :param project: Name of Project of test :param dut: Device under test Note Line 162: The initialization adds a blank ChannelGroup to the MDF file to avoid a bug with CANape. If the file contains only one ChannelGroup, it will be considered “sorted” and will not parse correctly.

addChannelGroup(newCG)[source]¶

Method to add ChannelGroup object to MDF. All ChannelGroup objects (or CANmsg objects) must be added to MDF before file header is written. :param newCG: New ChannelGroup/CANmsg object to be added to MDF.

closefile()[source]¶

Method to close file once data is finished being written. Must be called, otherwise file will corrupt.

defineStartTime(timestamp)[source]¶

To change timestamp in header. All time offsets in data block of file will reference this time. :param timestamp: HH:MM:SS

getEpochTime()[source]¶

Translates MDF spec timestamp format to epoch time for conversion to time offset float value

importDEJ(dej_path)[source]¶

Method to import a DEJ into the MDF. :param dej_path: System path to .dej file

openFile(filename)[source]¶

Automatically called upon instantation of MDF object. :param Name of file to be created.

startfile()[source]¶

Method to write header and respective pointers to tie everything together.

write(channelGroupName, timestamp, value)[source]¶

Method to write data record to file. Only to be called once file is open and header is written. :param cg: Reference to CG associated with data :param timestamp: Decimal offset from timestamp in header :param value: Either raw CAN message data from CAN bus, or a List [] of data for each signal in ChannelGroup
